skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, PubChem, Reactome, QuickGO. Unified API for queries, ID mapping, pathway analysis. For direct REST control, use individual database skills (uniprot-database, kegg-database).
skill.summary: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or persistence patterns were found. Network usage aligns with documented bioinformatics API calls. The scripts focus on data retrieval and local file outputs.

content.user_title: Run bioinformatics lookups across many databases
content.value_statement: You need to combine protein, pathway, and compound data across services. This skill provides a unified Python workflow with ready scripts.
actual_capabilities: Search UniProt and retrieve FASTA sequences
Map identifiers across UniProt, KEGG, and UniChem
Analyze KEGG pathways and export CSV and SIF
Run BLAST searches through NCBI services
Query protein interaction databases via PSICQUIC
Retrieve Gene Ontology annotations via QuickGO
limitations: Requires network access to external bioinformatics services
BLAST searches require a valid email address
Output quality depends on upstream database availability
Scripts assume Python and bioservices are installed

use_cases.title: Protein workflow
use_cases.description: Retrieve a protein sequence, run BLAST, and list related pathways in one flow.

use_cases.title: Compound mapping
use_cases.description: Cross reference KEGG compounds to ChEBI and ChEMBL identifiers.

use_cases.title: Teaching demo
use_cases.description: Show students how to integrate UniProt, KEGG, and GO data.

prompt_templates.title: Quick ID mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map UniProt ID P43403 to KEGG and show the KEGG IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Compound lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the KEGG compound ID for Geldanamycin and map it to ChEMBL.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze KEGG pathways for hsa and save summaries to ./output.

prompt_templates.title: Full protein pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the protein analysis workflow for ZAP70_HUMAN with my email and skip BLAST.

output_examples.input: Analyze KEGG pathways for hsa and summarize key outputs.
output: Paths to the summary CSV and SIF files

best_practices: Use organism codes like hsa and mmu for KEGG calls
Handle API errors with try and except blocks
Save outputs to a dedicated directory for each run
anti_patterns: Do not call BLAST without a valid email address
Do not assume mapping results exist for every ID
Do not run large organism analyses without a limit during testing

faq.question: Is this compatible with Python 3.11?
faq.answer: Yes, the documentation states support for Python 3.9 to 3.12.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on each external service and can vary over time.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts can be adapted and the API is usable directly in Python.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or files?
faq.answer: No, the code only accesses inputs you provide and writes local outputs.

faq.question: What if a service fails or times out?
faq.answer: Handle errors and consider increasing timeouts or retrying requests.

faq.question: How does it compare to direct REST calls?
faq.answer: It provides a unified API and scripts, while direct REST offers finer control.
